info.title: NIAEFEUP Website - Backend API specification
info.description:
This specification documents the available endpoints and possible operations on the website's backend.
For each of the operations, its purpose, security, requests and possible responses are documented.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for authentication management.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for account management.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for event management.

tags.name: Posts
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for post management.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for project management.

get.description: The operation returns an array of accounts, allowing to easily retrieve all the created accounts.

post.description: This endpoint operation creates new accounts.

get.description: This endpoint allows the retrieval of a single account using its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the account to retrieve

post.description: Replaces sets a new account password

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the account to change the password.

get.description: This endpoint operation allows to check if a given access token is valid, returning the associated account's information.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer authentication token

AUTH/CheckToken/should fail when access.value: {"errors":[{"message":"An error occurred while attempting to decode the Jwt: Invalid JWT serialization: Missing dot delimiter(s)"}]}

post.description: This endpoint operation allows authentication using user's password and email, generating new access and refresh tokens to be used in later communication.
This endpoint operation allows the renewal of access tokens when expiring, using the appropriate refresh token.

get.description:
The operation returns an array of events, allowing to easily retrieve all the created events.
This is useful for example in the frontend's event page, where events are displayed.

EVENT/GetAllEvents/should return all eve.value: [{"title":"Great event","description":"This was a nice and iconic event","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"registerUrl":"https://docs.google.com/forms","dateInterval":{"startDate":"28-07-2022","endDate":"30-07-2022"},"location":"FEUP","category":"Great Events","thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail","associatedRoles":[],"id":1,"slug":"great-event"},{"title":"Bad event","description":"This event was a failure","teamMembers":[],"dateInterval":{"startDate":"27-10-2021"},"thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail2","associatedRoles":[],"id":2}]

get.description: This endpoint allows the retrieval of events labeled with a given category. It might be used to filter events in the event page.
get.operationId: EVENT/GetEventsByCategory/should return all events of the category

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Category of the events to retrieve

get.description: The operation returns an array of posts, allowing to easily retrieve all the created posts.

POST/GetAllPosts/should return all posts.value: [{"title":"New test released","body":"this is a test post","thumbnailPath":"https://thumbnails/test.png","publishDate":"02-03-2023","lastUpdatedAt":"02-03-2023 11:19:00","id":1,"slug":"new-test-released"},{"title":"NIAEFEUP gets a new president","body":"New president promised to buy new chairs","thumbnailPath":"https://thumbnails/pres.png","publishDate":"02-03-2023","lastUpdatedAt":"02-03-2023 11:19:00","id":2}]

post.description: This endpoint operation creates new posts.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the post to retrieve

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the post to update

get.description: The operation returns an array of projects, allowing to easily retrieve all the created projects. This is useful for example in the frontend project page, where projects are displayed.

PROJECT/GetAllProjects/should return all.value: [{"title":"Awesome project","description":"this is a test project","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"isArchived":false,"technologies":["Java","Kotlin","Spring"],"associatedRoles":[],"id":1,"slug":"awesome-project"},{"title":"NIJobs","description":"Job platform for students","teamMembers":[],"isArchived":false,"technologies":["ExpressJS","React"],"associatedRoles":[],"id":2}]

put.description: This endpoint updates projects as archived. This is useful to mark no longer maintained or complete projects of the Nucleus.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the project to archive

PROJECT/ArchiveProject/should archive th.value: {"title":"Awesome project","description":"this is a test project","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"isArchived":true,"technologies":["Java","Kotlin","Spring"],"associatedRoles":[],"id":1,"slug":"awesome-project"}

put.description: This endpoint updates projects as unarchived. This is useful to mark previously unarchived projects as active.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the project to unarchive
